title: Exhibit: The Perfect Sea Mural
description:
Date: October 21, 2021

Members of the South Shore Artists Group created an engaging and interactive mural entitled "The Perfect Sea" to educate children and adults about the sea and its ecology; in particular, how pollution affects sea life in our local waters.

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

Free admission.

All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (917) 417-6917

Location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
categories: Education | Art | Best for Kids | Seniors

title: Exhibit: Fire and Tide - Terra Marine Inn: A Brief History of Huguenot Park, Staten Island
description:
Date: October 21, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (917) 417-6817

Location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
categories: Art | History

title: First Forest Discovery
description:
Date: October 21, 2021

For ages 5-7 with caregiver

Join us for an exploration of the critters that make their home on the ground. On this hike, we will observe up close and record our findings.

The Greenbelt’s open spaces provide an opportunity for children to connect with nature and discover the wonders of our unique urban forest. Within a landscape of plants and trees, children and their caregivers will have the opportunity to explore, move, create and learn in a safe and welcoming environment.

First Forest Discovery is suitable for one child accompanied by one caregiver.

** Due to limited space, this is a non-refundable program.

title: SUBMERGE Marine Science Festival
description:
Date: October 21, 2021

HRPK's SUBMERGE Marine Science Festival, an annual celebration of NYC’s coastal waters is back to inspire budding scientists with three days of in-person and virtual programming. This year’s festival features a jam-packed lineup of in-person activities, virtual panels, wildlife tours, and more. Each day of the festival is centered on the importance of our local waterways, with themes focused on wildlife, harbor habitat, and River health.

Hudson River Park’s River Project is committed to advancing public awareness and understanding of our local waterways. During SUBMERGE, the Park’s River Project partners with 20 local organizations to help educate our community while showcasing local habitats and wildlife. The festival aims to inspire audiences of all ages with a STEM-focused curriculum to make marine science accessible and engaging for everyone.

OCTOBER 19

LOCAL WILDLIFE
10:00 AM Partner Showcase - Virtual
11:00 AM Local Wildlife Panel - Virtual
12:00 PM Science Performance with Al - Virtual
5:00 PM Wetlab Look-in at Pier 40

OCTOBER 20

HARBOR HABITAT
10:00 AM Partner Showcase - Virtual
11:00 AM Harbor Habitat Panel - Virtual
12:00 PM Science Performance with Al - Virtual
5:00 PM Tide Deck Tour at Pier 46

OCTOBER 21

RIVER HEALTH
10:00 AM Partner Showcase - Virtual
11:00 AM River Health Panel - Virtual
12:00 PM Science Performance with Al - Virtual
5:00 PM Shell-ebrate Oysters at Pier 40

SUBMERGE is supported by BASIS Independent Schools, an education system designed to teach students an advanced, immersive curriculum that will prepare them to be innovative leaders.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 7:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 627-2020

Location: Hudson River Park's Pier 40,Hudson River Park's Pier 26
location: Hudson River Park's Pier 40,Hudson River Park's Pier 26
categories: Education | Nature | Festivals | Best for Kids | Tours | Talks | Waterfront | Fishing | Wildlife

title: River Project: Live From the Field
description:
Date: October 21, 2021

Wildlife thrives all over NYC, especially in HRPK's waters! Tune into @HudsonRiverPark's Instagram Live for an insider’s look into the Park's Estuarine Sanctuary as we study environmental DNA, analyze microplastics, sample fish populations and so much more!

HRPK's River Project conducts research and offers hands-on environmental education and scientific programming with the purpose of communicating the ecological importance of the Park’s 400-acre Estuarine Sanctuary. Dedicated to community engagement, stewardship and learning, the River Project offers at-home STEM activities, tours of marine-biology stations and other educational resources to support scientific understanding of the Lower Hudson Estuary.

Start time: 2:00 pm

End time: 2:30 pm

Contact phone: (212) 627-2020

title: River Project: Wetlab Look-Ins
description:
Date: October 21, 2021

Our flow-through aquarium houses dozens of species of fish and invertebrates all caught within the Park as part of an ongoing ecological survey. Park staff will be available for tours and questions during the duration of open hours. If you can't make it to Pier 40, we will also be live streaming feeding and/or species spotlights each day on Facebook live @hudsonriverpark.

Animals are released each season to ensure that their behaviors and life cycles are minimally impacted.

Please make sure to bring a mask if you are attending in person.

Date: October 21, 2021

Born and raised in Puerto Rico and based in the Bronx, Grammy-winning bassist/composer/arranger John Benitez has led an accomplished career, working with major artists in a range of styles from Tito Puente, Eddie Palmieri and Batacumbele to Wynton Marsalis, Chucho Valdés and Roy Hargrove. For this concert he leads his Latin jazz sextet.

title: Movies Under the Stars: Under the Subway Video Art Night
description:
Date: October 21, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film!

Grab a blanket or a chair for the 20th edition of Under the Subway Video Art Night with over 30 videos curated by Antonio Ortuño. From its first edition in 2011, USVAN has distinguished itself by welcoming digital art videos of an experimental and performative nature. Since its inception, we have opened the door to disciplines that are different and unlike each other, but interrelated, thus raising awareness that video art is live art.

6:00 p.m. - Few words from the curator Antonio Ortuño

7:00 p.m. - Screening

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited.

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 6:00 pm

End time: 10:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 408-0243

title: Movies Under the Stars: SHOCKTOBERFEST - Blade
description:
Date: October 21, 2021

Join NYC Parks and New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment at SHOCKTOBERFEST for these spooky films!

BLADE (R)

This 1998 classic follows a vengeful vampire-hunter Blade (Wesley Snipes) as he makes it his mission to rid the world of the hidden society of undead who secretly prey on humanity. When a rebellious young vampire threatens to lead a new generation of bloodsuckers out of their shadowy underworld, it's up to the half-human, half-vampire Blade to prevent them from infesting Earth. Kris Kristofferson, N'Bushe Wright. Rated R.

Know Before You Go
This movie is rated R and contains explicit content intended for mature audiences. You should arrive before 6:15 p.m. to get your spot for the movie. Please bring your own picnic blanket or chair. Food is OK, but no alcohol or smoking is permitted. All are welcome!

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable

title: Dance in HRPK: Sunset Salsa
description:
Date: October 21, 2021

Sunset Salsa is led by world-renowned performer and instructor Talia Castro-Pozo, celebrated as “The Woman of Salsa” by Latina Magazine and trained in various forms of dance, from Ballroom to Jazz. Whether you’re a novice or an advanced dancer, Talia starts with beginner Salsa lessons before kicking off the night with a sizzling party. Dancers of all experience levels get to move to the music!

As the DJs spin, you can dance along—right on the water! Follow our social channels for announcements of special guests, schedule updates and weather cancellations.

The dancing begins Thursday, September 9 at 6:30 PM EDT and continues every Thursday through October 28 at Hudson River Park's Pier 45!

Registration in advance is required for this event.

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: October 22, 2021

Join us for Fitness at the Fort!

Incorporating climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing.

Instructor: Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS

Start: October 18, 2022

End : January 14, 2022

Hiatus: November 8-19

Fall/Winter 2021-2022 Class Descriptions:

Mondays: Easy Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Wednesdays: Moderate Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Fridays: Intense Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises.

Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path.

Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

Start time: 7:00 am

End time: 7:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
categories: Nature | Fitness | Outdoor Fitness | Seniors

title: Bend & Flex
description:
Date: October 22, 2021

Flexibility leads you to a better life! How does shoulder openings, bridge, calf and hamstring stretches sound to you? All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

title: Movies Under the Stars: Cruella
description:
Date: October 22, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film.

Cruella

Emma Stone (LA LA LAND) stars in Disney’s CRUELLA, a live-action feature film about the rebellious early days of one of cinema’s most notorious – and notoriously fashionable – villains, the legendary Cruella de Vil. Set during the 1970s punk rock revolution in London, the story follows a clever and creative young grifter named Estella, who is determined to become a successful designer. After Estella befriends a pair of young thieves who appreciate her appetite for mischief, the three build a life for themselves on the London streets. Before long, Estella’s flair for fashion catches the eye of the Baroness von Hellman, a devastatingly chic and terrifyingly haute fashion legend, played by Emma Thompson (HOWARDS END, SENSE AND SENSIBILITY). But their relationship sets in motion a course of events and revelations that will cause Estella to embrace her wicked side and become the raucous, fashionable, and revenge-bent Cruella. Rated PG-13.

Know Before You Go
You should arrive before 7:00 p.m. to get your spot. Feel free to bring a blanket to sit on; there will be a limited supply of chairs available. Bottled water is permitted, but not glass. Reservations are not taken; space is available on a first-come, first-served basis. All are welcome!

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited.

title: Broadway Berm Beautification Day - Fort Tryon Park
description:
Date: October 23, 2021

"Dig in" and help the Fort Tryon Park Trust and NYC Parks horticulture staff restore Fort Tryon Park’s area along Broadway and the Alpine Garden area. Activities include removing debris and invasive plant species, weeding, mulching, and planting. Tools and gloves will be provided. Please wear sturdy shoes, your face mask, and bring a filled water bottle.

Groups of 5 or more must pre-register at info@FortTryonParkTrust.org so we have enough supplies on hand.

Anyone under 18 must be accompanied by an adult.

The Fort Tryon Park Trust supports regular park stewardship activities by underwriting tools, plants, supplies, and NYC Parks staff to oversee projects.

title: Hellgate Farm Stand
description:
Date: October 23, 2021

Every Saturday at Socrates in the spring, summer, fall, Hellgate Farm offers fresh seasonal local produce and small batch goods, like their signature hot sauce. Cash, credit card and Venmo are accepted, plus Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), Farmers’ Market Nutrition Program (FMNP), and Health Bucks. Wilk Apiaries also pops up on select Saturdays to vend their variety of local and raw honeys.

About Hellgate Farm

Hellgate Farm is a network of residential and rooftop gardens in Queens, NYC. The farm aims to promote urban gardening and a permaculture lifestyle within their local community, providing opportunities for people interested in these practices to connect and learn, as well as share in the abundance of the harvest.

title: Ocean Breeze Green Team Volunteer Event
description:
Date: October 23, 2021

Ocean Breeze Park is a beautiful 140-acre park consisting of wetlands, grasslands, and shrub forests. This area is home to innumerable species of wildlife needing your caring hands as we work together in stewardship and restoration of our beloved park. Volunteers will be participating in hands-on projects in our park and green spaces. This may include trail maintenance, clean-up projects, invasive weed removal, planting, and other environmental projects. Further information will be provided upon registration.

Fall 2021 Green Team Dates:

  • Saturday, October 2: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, October 9: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, October 16: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, October 23: 10am – noon
  • Sunday, October 24: 10am – noon
  • Saturday, November 13: 10am – noon

The Ocean Breeze Green Team includes environmental and stewardship projects for volunteers in the trails and at the facility. Tasks will include hands-on work like planting, mulching, debris removal, shoveling, crafting, and more. title: Summer on the Hudson: Monuments Tour of Riverside Park
description:
Date: October 23, 2021

The New York Historical Society and Summer on the Hudson are partnering for a Monuments of Riverside Park Walking Tour through one of New York City’s Scenic Landmarks. Join us for a guided walk along Riverside Drive that highlights the park’s development as well as its historic monuments.

The tours are split into two parts. Put on your walking shoes—each part is approximately 1.5 miles long! The South Tour begins at the 72nd Street park entrance and proceeds north to the West 94th Street Joan of Arc statue. The North Tour begins at the 122nd Street General Grant National Memorial and proceeds south to the West 100th Street Fireman’s Memorial. Space is limited, and registration is required.

  • South Tour: Saturday, October 23 | 10:30 am to 12 pm
  • North Tour: Sunday, October 24 | 10:30 am to 12 pm

Know Before You Go
For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Additionally, we encourage participants to bring their own hand sanitizer to our programs.

Start time: 10:30 am

End time: 12:00 pm

title: Central Park Youth Basketball Clinics
description:
Date: October 23, 2021

Enhance your basketball skills through small group instruction and competitive games.

It's not just shooting hoops! Our high-energy, interactive youth basketball clinics cultivate skill development, team play, and sportsmanship both on and off the court. Players aged 6–14 are encouraged to join us on Saturdays and Sundays from July 10 to August 28, 2021. From September 11 to October 30, 2021, clinics will be held on Saturdays only. FREE and open to players of all levels. On-site registration each day on a first-come, first-served basis.

Ages 6–10
11:00 a.m. – 11:30 a.m.: Check In
11:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.: Basketball Clinic

Ages 11–14
12:30 p.m. – 1:00 p.m.: Check In
1:00 p.m. – 2:30 p.m.: Basketball Clinic

In case of inclement weather, call (347) 443-0656 to confirm cancellation on the day.

COVID-19 HEALTH AND SAFETY POLICIES

Ensuring the health and safety of our guests, staff, and the public is our top priority. Central Park Conservancy programs follow recommended guidelines from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, New York State, and New York City and have adopted enhanced cleaning procedures to ensure a safe playing environment.

This year’s Youth Basketball Clinics ask unvaccinated players to:

  • wear face masks that completely cover their nose and mouth for the duration of the program.
  • complete an on-site health assessment and temperature check prior to playing.

Regardless of vaccination status, all players should continue to monitor themselves for COVID-19 symptoms and stay home if they feel unwell.

Read about policies related to COVID-19, inclement weather, and more on our Frequently Asked Questions page.

Please fill out the Health Assessment form prior to attending the program.

Join Brooklyn Bridge Park Conservancy for the 11th annual Harvest Festival! Celebrate the changing of the seasons on Pier 6 with a day full of family-friendly activities — including a kick-off procession, arts and crafts, storytelling, lawn games, our signature pumpkin patch, and more.

We have a great lineup of community partners who will help make the return a very special (and safe) event, including:

  • Music and dancing by Hudson Horns, Brooklyn Contra, and DJ Likwuid
  • Magic by Dennis Kim (The Close Up Artist) and stilt-walking by Brianna Kalisch
  • Book offerings by Brooklyn Public Library, Drag Queen Story Hour, and Brooklyn Book Bodega
  • Activities by Brooklyn Children's Museum, DSNY / Big Reuse, North American Indigenous Center of NY, Park Slope Parents, Private Picassos, Sarah C Scholl, The YMCA, the Conservancy's Environmental Education Center.

Full details and activities available here

This event is free and open to the public. No advanced registration required. Please check the Brooklyn Bridge Park website for any changes.

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 3:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 802-0603

Location: Pier 6 (in Brooklyn Bridge Park)
categories: Festivals | Fall Festivals

title: Tour of Washington Square Park
description:

For nearly two centuries Washington Square Park has served as a beloved hub for locals while attracting visitors from around the world. Join a Washington Square Park Conservancy docent for a free tour and learn about the expansive and colorful history of this space. Take a journey through time and learn about the park’s beginnings as a parade ground, the unmistakable monuments, and the many people that have made Washington Square Park the cultural icon that it is today.

No pre-registration required.

description:

title: Theater to the People: Dreams & Nightmares
description:
Date: October 23, 2021

Join Theater to the People for their first in-person public performance since April 2019! Dreams and Nightmares takes you on a poetic journey through the hearts and minds of this diverse group, with movement, music, and original creative writing by the performers. Using ideas about our lives in dreams contributed by the public during open workshops in Old Stone House Washington Park in July 2021, this third Theater to the People ensemble has devised a kaleidoscopic collage performance over the course of only eleven sessions.

Theater to the People is a collaboration between the physical theater artist Julia Cavagna and the playwright/director Kate Bell. It focuses on bringing bilingual (Spanish/English) and socially engaged theater-making experiences to adults with little to no previous drama experience. TTTP brings together many perspectives from people living in New York City: new immigrants, people who identify as first-generation Americans, people who have lived here for generations, and people who might identify as “gentrifiers.” TTTP seeks to inspire community organizing and resilience by building creative, social, and political alliances among people from a wide variety of backgrounds through the act of collaboratively making theater.

Accessibility:

JJ Byrne Playground and the Old Stone House are located within Washington Park in Park Slope Brooklyn at 5th Avenue between 3rd and 4th Streets.

The performance will occur in front of the Old Stone House on the lawn.

There are two public restrooms at Old Stone House open to people of all genders.

COVID-19 Protocol:

Performers will not be masked for the duration of the performance. We encourage physical distancing and advise audience members to wear masks. Masks and hand sanitizer will be made readily available.

Start time: 2:00 pm

End time: 3:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Outdoors at Old Stone House (in J.J. Byrne Playground)

title: 'All Good Things Ep 01' Concert
description:
Date: October 23, 2021

Critical Party Studies presents All Good Things Ep 01, a concert event hosted by Charlie Bardey.

Free, outdoors on 4th Street between 4th and 5th Avenues.

KING CARTER
kingcarter.bandcamp.com

MAASSAI
maassai.bandcamp.com
Born and bred in Brooklyn, NY, maassai sonically blends the gritty energy of the city when she was growing up with her love for the avant-garde.

SYL DUBENION
syldubenion.bandcamp.com
Syl DuBenion is a black American artist of many mediums. As a saxophonist, singer-songwriter-composer, and performer, he travels through different genres and modes to share his truth. He is a steadfast contributor to the New York City arts scene, hailing from Buffalo, NY.

MAY RIO
mayrio.bandcamp.com
It is May Rio’s personality and deftness that ultimately shine and make her solo debut the unexpected journey that it is. It is intelligent like a riddle and catchy like an over-saturated cartoon. On Easy Bammer, May turns months of isolation into a curious & hyperreal reflection on memory of a time in New York City before stay-at-home-orders and lukewarm take-out—reflections on a time when staying at home & thinking felt like an unreasonable request of the cosmos. May Rio’s Easy Bammer gives its listener a chance to experience the warmth & quiet laughter of reflection; it does so in a time otherwise reserved for most as an endless cycle of waiting for new headlines.

HOSTED BY CHARLIE BARDEY!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ktzUFe7wCfA&t=4s

This event is supported by a New York City Artist Corps Grant.

Start time: 3:00 pm

End time: 7:00 pm

title: Trail of the Month" High Rock Park: Green Trail/Moses Mt.
description:
Date: October 24, 2021

Get to know the Greenbelt trails by joining us each month for a different hiking adventure.

This is a brisk-paced hike; mileage is approximately 3 miles. Duration will depend on the pace/size of the group. Please dress for the weather and terrain. Bring water and a snack.

Registration: By registering for this event, you confirm that you have read our Covid-19 precautions and media consent. The event is free but registration is required.

Gear: Wear clothes you don’t mind getting dirty, long, light-colored pants are preferred. Closed-toe shoes (sneakers or boots) are required. Please bring water, sunscreen, and insect repellent.

Cancellation: This program may be canceled if registration is too low, or if there is inclement weather predicted on the day of the event. Please ensure that we have your correct information so that we can contact you in the event of a cancellation. As we receive cancellations, names will be added from the waitlist. If you know you will be unable to attend, please cancel your registration by emailing sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com or calling (718) 351-3450 ext. 0, so we can fill the reservation.

Media Consent: By registering for this program, you are agreeing to have your image used in promotional materials by the Greenbelt Conservancy, including but not limited to, photographs and video. If you choose not to give consent, please let us know by emailing us at sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com before the event.

Covid-19 Precautions:

-All Visitors and Staff must wear a mask during the entire event.

-Masks and Hand sanitizer will be available.

-All equipment will be sanitized before and after the event. (will be included if we are using equipment)

-By participating in this event you are acknowledging that you and your guests have not experienced a fever, not tested positive for COVID-19, and have not been exposed to anyone with COVID-19 within 14 days of the event. Should you develop symptoms after registration, please cancel your registration by emailing sigreenbelteducation@gmail.com.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone:

title: Summer on the Hudson: Monuments Tour of Riverside Park
description:
Date: October 24, 2021

The New York Historical Society and Summer on the Hudson are partnering for a Monuments of Riverside Park Walking Tour through one of New York City’s Scenic Landmarks. Join us for a guided walk along Riverside Drive that highlights the park’s development as well as its historic monuments.

The tours are split into two parts. Put on your walking shoes—each part is approximately 1.5 miles long! The South Tour begins at the 72nd Street park entrance and proceeds north to the West 94th Street Joan of Arc statue. The North Tour begins at the 122nd Street General Grant National Memorial and proceeds south to the West 100th Street Fireman’s Memorial. Space is limited, and registration is required.

  • South Tour: Saturday, October 23 | 10:30 am to 12 pm
  • North Tour: Sunday, October 24 | 10:30 am to 12 pm

Know Before You Go
For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask

Free to the public, all ages are welcome to participate in the simul, and five spots will be reserved for players 12 and under. This year’s event is dedicated to the memory of longtime Greenwich Village resident and community activist, Doris Deither.

title: 'Mendelssohn on the Hudson' - Tour & Meet the Artist
description:
Date: October 24, 2021

Join the Fort Tryon Park Trust and Inwood Art Works for a "meet the artist" guided podcast tour of episodes 10-12 of the 12-part Mendelssohn on the Hudson production.

This musical and historical tour follows the footsteps of the German Jews and others who fled 1930s Nazi Germany to settle in Washington Heights, also referred to at the time as “Frankfurt on the Hudson.” Visitors will hear episodes with songs based on true field-collected stories from neighborhood residents set to Felix Mendelssohn's Songs without Words and featuring neighborhood landmarks like those in Fort Tryon Park.

Meet the artist and start the tour at Heather Garden's Margaret Corbin Circle entrance at 3:00 p.m. Each podcast is five minutes in length and the artist will lead attendees on the three episodes that center on Fort Tryon Park. There will be a Q&A with the artist following the tour. Bring headphones and your smartphone to be able to hear the podcast in real-time.

Start time: 3:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)

Join NYC Parks and New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment at SHOCKTOBERFEST for these spooky films!

Nosferatu: A Symphony of Horror (1922)

A cornerstone of horror, this 1922 silent German Expressionist film follows the mysterious Count Orlok as he infiltrates the lives of his real estate agent, Thomas Hutter and his young wife, Ellen. Considered an unauthorized adaptation of Bram Stoker's Dracula, NOSFERATU remains to many viewers the most unsettling vampire film ever made, and its bald, spidery vampire, personified by the diabolical Max Schreck, continues to spawn imitations in the realm of contemporary cinema. Rated NR.

Know Before You Go
This film is silent with English subtitles. You should arrive before 6:00 p.m. to get your spot for the movie. Please bring your own picnic blanket or chair. Food is OK, but no alcohol or smoking is permitted. All are welcome!

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 6:00 pm

End time: 7:34 pm

Contact phone: (718) 965-8942

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: October 25, 2021

Join us for Fitness at the Fort!

Incorporating climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing.

Instructor: Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS

Start: October 18, 2022

End : January 14, 2022

Hiatus: November 8-19

Fall/Winter 2021-2022 Class Descriptions:

Mondays: Easy Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Wednesdays: Moderate Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Fridays: Intense Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises.

Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path.

Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

End time: 7:45 am

title: Exhibit: The Perfect Sea Mural
description:
Date: October 26, 2021

Members of the South Shore Artists Group created an engaging and interactive mural entitled "The Perfect Sea" to educate children and adults about the sea and its ecology; in particular, how pollution affects sea life in our local waters.

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

Free admission.

All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed

title: Exhibit: Fire and Tide - Terra Marine Inn: A Brief History of Huguenot Park, Staten Island
description:
Date: October 26, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

title: Fall Volunteer Days at the Bronx River Foodway
description:
Date: October 26, 2021

Lend a hand and connect with community and friends during our upcoming First Saturdays at the Foodway programming! Support morning stewardship, which includes gardening and beautifying of New York City's only edible food forest. Join us as well for some tours around our food forest, where we discuss the value of these herbs and veggies for both our health and the environment.

Hand sanitizer, masks, gloves, social distancing guidelines, and temperature checks provided to prevent the spread of Covid-19.

Thank you for being interested in volunteering with the Bronx River Alliance. You are committing to a special effort during a special time.

Please review the NYC Guidelines for Volunteering in Parks during COVID:

  • Stay home if sick (e.g., running a fever, coughing, experiencing loss of taste or smell, or other Covid-19 symptoms)
  • Maintain 6 feet of distance
  • Wash hands and clean surfaces frequently
  • Wear face coverings

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 542-4284

Location: Concrete Plant Park
categories: Nature | Best for Kids | Tours | Volunteer | Waterfront

title: Watercolor Workshops
description:
Date: October 26, 2021

Join us for a watercolor painting workshop series in partnership with Seeds of the League. Artist Kenneth Fitzpatrick will teach you how to draw and paint using nature as your inspiration. Learn about light, color, and design while making art en plein air (outside). All levels from beginners to advanced are welcome.

For your comfort, bring a mat or chair.

About the artist:

Kenneth Fitzpatrick, a graduate of the High School of Art & Design, was born and raised in New York City. His awards include P.S. Art, a citywide competition for pre-K to 12, culminating in an exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and a Seeds of the League Scholarship. Ken’s work focuses on compositional storytelling using the mediums of oils, graphite, watercolors, tattoos, and digital art. His goals include finishing his degree in game development and encouraging others to pursue their art.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 12:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: H.H. Biddle House (in Conference House Park)

categories: Arts & Crafts | Art | Arts, Culture & Fun Series

If you can't make it to Pier 40, we will also be live streaming feeding and/or species spotlights each day on Facebook live @hudsonriverpark.

Animals are released each season to ensure that their behaviors and life cycles are minimally impacted.

Please make sure to bring a mask if you are attending in person.

title: Summer on the Hudson: Moving For Life
description:
Date: October 26, 2021

Moving for Life is a gentle workout that begins with breathing exercises, then moves into active aerobic dancing that strengthens body awareness.

Pre-registration for the event is required. Management reserves the right to cap participation in accordance with current COVID-19 outdoor safety guidelines.

Please register online.

Please note: We are offering outdoor programs with limited attendance so that you can have a safe and enjoyable time in parks. Based on New York State guidance for outdoor events during COVID-19, we’ve put protocols into place to keep our participants and staff safe and healthy. We're asking everyone to help us stay safe.

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Additionally, we encourage participants to bring their own hand sanitizer to our programs.

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: October 27, 2021

Join us for Fitness at the Fort!

Incorporating climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing.

Instructor: Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS

Start: October 18, 2022

End : January 14, 2022

Hiatus: November 8-19

Fall/Winter 2021-2022 Class Descriptions:

Mondays: Easy Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Wednesdays: Moderate Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Fridays: Intense Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises.

Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path.

Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

Start time: 7:00 am

End time: 7:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

Free admission.

All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed

title: Exhibit: Fire and Tide - Terra Marine Inn: A Brief History of Huguenot Park, Staten Island
description:
Date: October 27, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

Start time: 10:00 am

title: Watercolor Workshop
description:
Date: October 27, 2021

Join us for a watercolor painting workshop series in partnership with Seeds of the League. Artist Kenneth Fitzpatrick will teach you how to draw and paint using nature as your inspiration. Learn about light, color, and design while making art en plein air (outside). All levels from beginners to advanced are welcome.

For your comfort, bring a mat or chair.

About the artist: Kenneth Fitzpatrick, a graduate of the High School of Art & Design, was born and raised in New York City. His awards include P.S. Art, a citywide competition for pre-K to 12, culminating in an exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and a Seeds of the League Scholarship. Ken’s work focuses on compositional storytelling using the mediums of oils, graphite, watercolors, tattoos, and digital art. His goals include finishing his degree in game development and encouraging others to pursue their art.

Start time: 4:00 pm

End time: 6:00 pm

title: Movies Under the Stars: Twitches
description:
Date: October 27, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film.

Twitches

Destiny brings twin witches, separated at birth, back together on their 21st birthday to fight a dark force that is threatening their long-lost birth mother. Rated TV-G.

Know Before You Go
You should arrive before 7:00 p.m. to get your spot. Feel free to bring a blanket to sit on; there will be a limited supply of chairs available. Bottled water is permitted, but not glass. Reservations are not taken; space is available on a first-come, first-served basis. All are welcome!

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited.

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 7:00 pm

End time: 8:30 pm

Contact phone: (718) 667-3545

Location: Lyons Pool
categories: Film | Best for Kids | Halloween | Free Summer Movies | Movies Under the Stars

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

Free admission.

All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed

title: Exhibit: Fire and Tide - Terra Marine Inn: A Brief History of Huguenot Park, Staten Island
description:
Date: October 28, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

title: River Project: Live From the Field
description:
Date: October 28, 2021

Wildlife thrives all over NYC, especially in HRPK's waters! Tune into @HudsonRiverPark's Instagram Live for an insider’s look into the Park's Estuarine Sanctuary as we study environmental DNA, analyze microplastics, sample fish populations and so much more!

HRPK's River Project conducts research and offers hands-on environmental education and scientific programming with the purpose of communicating the ecological importance of the Park’s 400-acre Estuarine Sanctuary. Dedicated to community engagement, stewardship and learning, the River Project offers at-home STEM activities, tours of marine-biology stations and other educational resources to support scientific understanding of the Lower Hudson Estuary.

Start time: 2:00 pm

End time: 2:30 pm

Contact phone: (212) 627-2020

title: River Project: Wetlab Look-Ins
description:
Date: October 28, 2021

Our flow-through aquarium houses dozens of species of fish and invertebrates all caught within the Park as part of an ongoing ecological survey. Park staff will be available for tours and questions during the duration of open hours. If you can't make it to Pier 40, we will also be live streaming feeding and/or species spotlights each day on Facebook live @hudsonriverpark.

Animals are released each season to ensure that their behaviors and life cycles are minimally impacted.

Please make sure to bring a mask if you are attending in person.

title: Watercolor Workshops
description:
Date: October 28, 2021

Join us for a watercolor painting workshop series in partnership with Seeds of the League. Artist Kenneth Fitzpatrick will teach you how to draw and paint using nature as your inspiration. Learn about light, color, and design while making art en plein air (outside). All levels from beginners to advanced are welcome.

For your comfort, bring a mat or chair.

About the artist: Kenneth Fitzpatrick, a graduate of the High School of Art & Design, was born and raised in New York City. His awards include P.S. Art, a citywide competition for pre-K to 12, culminating in an exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and a Seeds of the League Scholarship. Ken’s work focuses on compositional storytelling using the mediums of oils, graphite, watercolors, tattoos, and digital art. His goals include finishing his degree in game development and encouraging others to pursue their art.

Start time: 4:00 pm

End time: 6:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: DeMatti Park Fieldhouse (in De Matti Park)
location: DeMatti Park Fieldhouse (in De Matti Park)
categories: Arts & Crafts | Art | Arts, Culture & Fun Series

title: Movies Under the Stars: Shola's Voice
description:
Date: October 28, 2021

Come join The Mayor’s Office of Immigrant Affairs’ We Speak NYC program, in partnership with CUNY, Democracy NYC, and NYC Parks for a special outdoor screening of their new episode, Shola’s Voice, all about democracy in our city.

Shola's Voice

What difference does a blouse make? What difference does democracy make? Shola’s Voice is a story about a blouse and a lot more—the power of voting, education, health care, housing, and other issues that matter to you, your family, and the community. Watch Shola’s Voice and discover the power of Shola’s voice and your own.

Grab a blanket and come enjoy a movie in a neighborhood park or playground! This summer, NYC Parks will host family-friendly movie showings across the five boroughs. Movies begin at dusk. You should arrive by 5:30 p.m. to get your spot. This event is FREE and open to the public, but seating is limited. Reservations are not taken.

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited.

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 5:30 pm

End time: 8:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Highbridge Recreation Center (in Highbridge Park)
categories: Film | Movies Under the Stars

title: PASS Dialogue Series: Strange Love/EPISODES | What is courtship?
description:
Date: October 28, 2021

Be a part of an exciting collaborative creative discussion series and site-specific performance with nathan trice / RITUALS Dance. Theater. Music.

In this series of workshop-style conversations, 2021 PASS Artist nathan trice guides us through the creative process for his serialized work, Strange Love / EPISODES. Using themes from the books of bell hooks' "All About Love" and Esther Perel's "Mating In Captivity," this project explores and illustrates the anatomy and beauty of local community perspectives on courtship, intimacy, and love. Over this one-year residency, trice will initiate a series of monthly discussions with the local and virtual Snug Harbor community to help build a culminating site-specific performance at the Newhouse Center for Contemporary Art during the summer of 2022. The goal of this residency is to invite participants' stories and perspectives to help give life, form, and function to the 2022 site-specific performance of Strange Love: EPISODES at the Newhouse Center for Contemporary Art.

PASS Dialogues Series: Strange Love/EPISODES schedule:

Strange Love: EPISODES concept, process & goals: Thursday, October 14, 2021 | 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM via Zoom
What is courtship?: Thursday, October 28, 2021 | 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM via Zoom
What is intimacy?: Thursday, November 18, 2021 | 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM via Zoom
What is Love?: Saturday, December 11, 2021 | 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM, Newhouse Center, Gallery G

Advance registration is requested to attend. Upon registration, you will receive a Zoom link. While we encourage your participation in all of the workshops, it is not required—join us for as much as you can.

About the Artists

Nathan Trice is originally from Detroit, MI. He is a 1990 honorable discharged veteran who began his artistic career while simultaneously completing the remaining two years of a four-and-a-half year contract with the US NAVAL Service. Upon completion of his Naval service he was accepted and completed the Alvin Ailey American Dance Center 2-year Certificate Program in 1993 and went on to spend the following six years as a featured artist with MOMIX dance company, Complexions Contemporary Ballet, Joseph Holmes Chicago Dance Theater/Deeply Rooted Dance Theater, Donald Byrd/The Group and Forces of Nature Dance Company.

In 1998 Nathan Trice found and began artistic directorship of nathan trice / RITUALS Dance. Theater. Music. Since its inception Trice has consistently presented artistic educational programs & performances that reflect the importance of empathy, compassion and understanding and has shared his work throughout the US, Aruba, Bermuda, Japan and Hong Kong.

In 2005 Trice received the RestorationART, now known as the Billie Holiday Theater, Youth Arts Academy Recognition Award for his innovative work with their youth arts program. In that same year Trice was also awarded an indefinite residency at The Billie Holiday Theater Arts program.

PASS: Performing Arts Salon Saturdays residency program is made possible through generous lead support from the Howard Gilman Foundation, with additional support from the Samuel I. Newhouse Foundation, and the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council. Snug Harbor is a proud partner with the CUNY Dance Initiative.

title: Candlelight Ghost Tours of “Manhattan’s Most Haunted House”
description:
Date: October 28, 2021

50-minute tours run every half hour, 6:30 p.m. to 10 p.m.

Doors slam, floorboards creak, voices call into the dead of night. Venture into “Manhattan’s Most Haunted House” by flickering candlelight to hear chilling – and true – tales of decades of otherworldly activity in the house, the results of years of paranormal investigations – and the latest stunning scientific findings.

The Tredwell family lived at 29 East 4th Street for nearly 100 years, and at least eight people died in the house. Reports of strange and inexplicable occurrences have been widespread since Gertrude, the last surviving Tredwell, died in 1933. Is it Gertrude who is watching over her family home? Join us on a Candlelight Tour and decide for yourself.

Start time: 6:30 pm

End time: 11:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 777-1089

Location: Merchant's House Museum

title: 'Super Spooky' Candlelight Ghost Tour with a Paranormal Investigator
description:
Date: October 28, 2021

Last year, the museum closed due to COVID-19, leaving the house empty of staff and visitors. Dan Sturges, who has undertaken paranormal investigations at the Merchant’s House for 14 years, teamed up with neuroscientist Dr. Lee to conduct scientific research using specialized equipment custom-built for the house. Mounting fact-based evidence points to the very likely reality of paranormal activity at the Merchant’s House.

Join paranormal investigator Dan Sturges on a 90-minute Super Spooky Candlelight Ghost Tour for an in-depth look at the latest research and findings.

description:
Date: October 29, 2021

Join us for Fitness at the Fort!

Incorporating climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing.

Instructor: Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS

Start: October 18, 2022

End : January 14, 2022

Hiatus: November 8-19

Fall/Winter 2021-2022 Class Descriptions:

Mondays: Easy Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Wednesdays: Moderate Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Fridays: Intense Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises.

Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path.

Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

Start time: 7:00 am

End time: 7:45 am

title: Not-so-Spooky Daffodil Planting
description:
Date: October 29, 2021

Join the Freshkills Park Alliance for a not-so-spooky clean-up at our Visitor Center. Help us lay our garden beds to rest by removing invasive species and planting Daffodil bulbs for the Daffodil project at our visitor center. NY4P’s Daffodil Project is the largest volunteer effort in NYC history and living memorial in remembrance of the victims of 9/11. Started in the spring following 9/11, the Daffodil Project is now in its 20th year.

Registration: Each ticket admits 1 car, containing up to 5 participants. During registration, you will be asked about additional participants in your car.

Transportation: By registering for this event, you confirm you will provide your own transportation. Because the site is under construction, all participants must provide their own car that will stay on-site the whole time. Participants may not use a bicycle, taxi or ride-share service.

Gear: Wear a hat and sturdy shoes that you don’t mind getting wet or muddy. Please also bring water, a snack, and sunblock.

Technology: Feel free to take photos, but consider carefully before bringing any electronic devices with you as they may possibly get wet, damaged, or dropped during the program.

Restrictions: You will be asked to sign an activity waiver before participating in the program.

Cancellation: This tour will be canceled if registration is too low, or if there is a 60% or greater chance of rain on the day of the event. You will be asked to confirm your registration by email before the tour. As we receive cancellations, names will be added from the waitlist. If you know you will be unable to attend, please cancel your registration by email info@freshkillspark.org so we can fill the reservation.

COVID-19 Precautions:

You will find current information on NYC Parks safety guidelines here.

Masks, Gloves, and Hand sanitizer will be available.

By participating in this event you are acknowledging that you and your guests have not experienced a fever, not tested positive for COVID-19, and have not been exposed to anyone with COVID-19 within 14 days of the event. Should you develop symptoms after registration, please cancel your registration by emailing info@freshkillspark.org.

--

Contact phone: (929) 481-2795

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

title: Wetland Clean up + Costumed Kayak Tour
description:
Date: October 29, 2021

Join the Freshkills Park Alliance for a wetland clean-up at our Kayak Launch site. Following the cleanup, volunteers will have the opportunity to Kayak along Freshkills Park's waterways! This two-mile round-trip paddle is a chance to explore the creeks and shorelines of Freshkills Park and experience the wildlife while the site is closed to the public.

Halloween is around the corner, so costumes are welcome and encouraged.

Registration: Each ticket admits 1 car, containing up to 4 participants. During registration, you will be asked about additional participants in your car.

Transportation: By registering for this event, you confirm you will provide your own transportation. Because the site is under construction, all participants must provide their own car that will stay on-site the whole time. Participants may not use a bicycle, taxi or ride-share service.

Gear: Wear a hat and sturdy shoes that you don’t mind getting wet or muddy. Please also bring water, a snack, and sunblock.

Technology: Feel free to take photos, but consider carefully before bringing any electronic devices with you as they may possibly get wet, damaged, or dropped during the program.

Restrictions: You will be asked to sign an activity waiver before participating in the program.

Cancellation: This tour will be canceled if registration is too low, or if there is a 60% or greater chance of rain on the day of the event. You will be asked to confirm your registration by email before the tour. As we receive cancellations, names will be added from the waitlist. If you know you will be unable to attend, please cancel your registration by emailing info@freshkillspark.org so we can fill the reservation.

COVID-19 Precautions:

You will find current information on NYC Parks safety guidelines here.

Masks, Gloves, and Hand sanitizer will be available.

By participating in this event you are acknowledging that you and your guests have not experienced a fever, not tested positive for COVID-19, and have not been exposed to anyone with COVID-19 within 14 days of the event. Should you develop symptoms after registration, please cancel your registration by emailing info@freshkillspark.org.

Can't make it for Spring Cleaning? You can still help by promoting our volunteer projects with your friends and neighbors. Students can receive credit for community service hours. We will also be adding more volunteer opportunities as the season continues.

Start time: 1:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (929) 481-2795

Location: Freshkills Park Event Entrance
categories: Nature | Halloween | Kayaking and Canoeing | Waterfront | Wildlife

title: Concert at Ruppert Park: The Blue Dahlia
description:
Date: October 29, 2021

Join NYC Parks and Council Member Ben Kallos for a fun afternoon of music!

Characterized by the sensual voice of jazz and French chanson, The Blue Dahlia offers an organic sound with electric energy.

Get tickets

Know Before You Go:

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

This event is FREE and open to the public.

For accessibility information, contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov.

This event is sponsored by Council Member Ben Kallos.

Start time: 3:00 pm

End time: 4:30 pm

Contact phone: (212) 408-0243

title: Watercolor Workshop
description:
Date: October 29, 2021

Join us for a watercolor painting workshop series in partnership with Seeds of the League. Artist Kenneth Fitzpatrick will teach you how to draw and paint using nature as your inspiration. Learn about light, color, and design while making art en plein air (outside). All levels from beginners to advanced are welcome.

For your comfort, bring a mat or chair.

About the artist: Kenneth Fitzpatrick, a graduate of the High School of Art & Design, was born and raised in New York City. His awards include P.S. Art, a citywide competition for pre-K to 12, culminating in an exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and a Seeds of the League Scholarship. Ken’s work focuses on compositional storytelling using the mediums of oils, graphite, watercolors, tattoos, and digital art. His goals include finishing his degree in game development and encouraging others to pursue their art.

Start time: 4:00 pm

End time: 6:00 pm

Contact phone:

Location: Walker Park Field House (in Walker Park)

title: Movie Night at Crocheron Park: Gremlins
description:
Date: October 29, 2021

Gremlins (1984)

Minature green monsters tear through the small town of Kingston Falls. Hijinks ensue as a mild-mannered bank teller releases these hideous loonies after gaining a new pet and violating two of three simple rules: No water (violated), no food after midnight (violated), and no bright light. Hilarious mayhem and destruction in a town straight out of Norman Rockwell. So, when your washing machine blows up or your TV goes on the fritz, before you call the repair man, turn on all the lights and look under all the beds. 'Cause you never can tell, there just might be a gremlin in your house.

Start time: 6:15 pm

End time: 8:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 352-4793

title: Candlelight Ghost Tours of “Manhattan’s Most Haunted House”
description:
Date: October 29, 2021

50-minute tours run every half hour, 6:30 to 10 p.m.

Doors slam, floorboards creak, voices call into the dead of night. Venture into “Manhattan’s Most Haunted House” by flickering candlelight to hear chilling – and true – tales of decades of otherworldly activity in the house, the results of years of paranormal investigations – and the latest stunning scientific findings.

The Tredwell family lived at 29 East 4th Street for nearly 100 years, and at least eight people died in the house. Reports of strange and inexplicable occurrences have been widespread since Gertrude, the last surviving Tredwell, died in 1933. Is it Gertrude who is watching over her family home? Join us on a Candlelight Tour and decide for yourself.

Start time: 6:30 pm

End time: 11:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 777-1089

Location: Merchant's House Museum
categories: History | Tours | Halloween

title: Movies Under the Stars: Halloweentown
description:
Date: October 29, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film.

Halloweentown

A benevolent witch must save her peaceful hometown from an invading dark force. Rated TV-PG.

Know Before You Go
You should arrive before 6:30 p.m. to get your spot. Feel free to bring a blanket to sit on; there will be a limited supply of chairs available. Bottled water is permitted, but not glass. Reservations are not taken; space is available on a first-come, first-served basis. All are welcome!

For everyone's safety, we are asking all participants to observe the following guidelines:

  • Please wear a mask if you are unvaccinated, or if it makes you feel more comfortable
  • All individuals should maintain social distancing of six feet during programming, regardless of vaccination status
  • Please wear a mask if social distancing cannot be maintained
  • Wash your hands before attending a program
  • Stay home if you are sick

Glass bottles and alcoholic beverages are strictly prohibited.

Contact (212) 360-1430 or accessibility@parks.nyc.gov for more information regarding accessibility.

Start time: 6:30 pm

End time: 8:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 667-3545

title: "Super Spooky" Candlelight Ghost Tour with a Paranormal Investigator
description:
Date: October 29, 2021

Last year, the museum closed due to COVID-19, leaving the house empty of staff and visitors. Dan Sturges, who has undertaken paranormal investigations at the Merchant’s House for 14 years, teamed up with neuroscientist Dr. Lee to conduct scientific research using specialized equipment custom-built for the house. Mounting fact-based evidence points to the very likely reality of paranormal activity at the Merchant’s House.

Join paranormal investigator Dan Sturges on a 90-minute Super Spooky Candlelight Ghost Tour for an in-depth look at the latest research and findings.

title: Hellgate Farm Stand
description:
Date: October 30, 2021

Every Saturday at Socrates in the spring, summer, fall, Hellgate Farm offers fresh seasonal local produce and small batch goods, like their signature hot sauce. Cash, credit card and Venmo are accepted, plus Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), Farmers’ Market Nutrition Program (FMNP), and Health Bucks. Wilk Apiaries also pops up on select Saturdays to vend their variety of local and raw honeys.

About Hellgate Farm

Hellgate Farm is a network of residential and rooftop gardens in Queens, NYC. The farm aims to promote urban gardening and a permaculture lifestyle within their local community, providing opportunities for people interested in these practices to connect and learn, as well as share in the abundance of the harvest.

title: Central Park Youth Basketball Clinics
description:
Date: October 30, 2021

Enhance your basketball skills through small group instruction and competitive games.

It's not just shooting hoops! Our high-energy, interactive youth basketball clinics cultivate skill development, team play, and sportsmanship both on and off the court. Players aged 6–14 are encouraged to join us on Saturdays and Sundays from July 10 to August 28, 2021. From September 11 to October 30, 2021, clinics will be held on Saturdays only. FREE and open to players of all levels. On-site registration each day on a first-come, first-served basis.

Ages 6–10
11:00 a.m. – 11:30 a.m.: Check In
11:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.: Basketball Clinic

Ages 11–14
12:30 p.m. – 1:00 p.m.: Check In
1:00 p.m. – 2:30 p.m.: Basketball Clinic

In case of inclement weather, call (347) 443-0656 to confirm cancellation on the day.

COVID-19 HEALTH AND SAFETY POLICIES

Ensuring the health and safety of our guests, staff, and the public is our top priority. Central Park Conservancy programs follow recommended guidelines from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, New York State, and New York City and have adopted enhanced cleaning procedures to ensure a safe playing environment.

This year’s Youth Basketball Clinics ask unvaccinated players to:

  • wear face masks that completely cover their nose and mouth for the duration of the program.
  • complete an on-site health assessment and temperature check prior to playing.

Regardless of vaccination status, all players should continue to monitor themselves for COVID-19 symptoms and stay home if they feel unwell.

Read about policies related to COVID-19, inclement weather, and more on our Frequently Asked Questions page.

Please fill out the Health Assessment form prior to attending the program.

Start time: 11:00 am

End time: 2:30 pm

Contact phone: (347) 443-0656

description:

Grab a blanket and come enjoy a movie in a neighborhood park or playground! This summer, NYC Parks will host family-friendly movie showings across the five boroughs. Movies begin at dusk. title: Candlelight Ghost Tours of “Manhattan’s Most Haunted House”
description:
Date: October 30, 2021

50-minute tours run every half hour, 6:30 p.m. to 10 p.m.

Doors slam, floorboards creak, voices call into the dead of night. Venture into “Manhattan’s Most Haunted House” by flickering candlelight to hear chilling – and true – tales of decades of otherworldly activity in the house, the results of years of paranormal investigations – and the latest stunning scientific findings.

The Tredwell family lived at 29 East 4th Street for nearly 100 years, and at least eight people died in the house. Reports of strange and inexplicable occurrences have been widespread since Gertrude, the last surviving Tredwell, died in 1933. Is it Gertrude who is watching over her family home? Join us on a Candlelight Tour and decide for yourself.

Start time: 6:30 pm

End time: 11:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 777-1089

Location: Merchant's House Museum
categories: History | Tours | Halloween

title: Movies Under the Stars: Coco
description:
Date: October 30, 2021

Join NYC Parks and the New York City Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment for a free film.

Coco

A boy named Miguel dreams of becoming a famous guitar player, despite the misgivings of his close-knit family. When his lofty ambitions cause him to run afoul of a curse, he must journey into the Land of the Dead to seek forgiveness from his ancestors. Rated PG.

Know Before You Go
You should arrive before 6:30 p.m. to get your spot. Feel free to bring a blanket to sit on; there will be a limited supply of chairs available. Bottled water is permitted, but not glass. Reservations are not taken; space is available on a first-come, first-served basis. All are welcome!

title: "Super Spooky" Candlelight Ghost Tour with a Paranormal Investigator
description:
Date: October 30, 2021

Last year, the museum closed due to COVID-19, leaving the house empty of staff and visitors. Dan Sturges, who has undertaken paranormal investigations at the Merchant’s House for 14 years, teamed up with neuroscientist Dr. Lee to conduct scientific research using specialized equipment custom-built for the house. Mounting fact-based evidence points to the very likely reality of paranormal activity at the Merchant’s House.

Join paranormal investigator Dan Sturges on a 90-minute Super Spooky Candlelight Ghost Tour for an in-depth look at the latest research and findings.

Start time: 10:30 pm

End time: 11:59 pm

Contact phone: (212) 777-1089

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: November 1, 2021

Join us for Fitness at the Fort!

Incorporating climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing.

Instructor: Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS

Start: October 18, 2022

End : January 14, 2022

Hiatus: November 8-19

Fall/Winter 2021-2022 Class Descriptions:

Mondays: Easy Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Wednesdays: Moderate Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Fridays: Intense Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises.

Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path.

Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

Start time: 7:00 am

End time: 7:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

title: Exhibit: The Perfect Sea Mural
description:
Date: November 1, 2021

Members of the South Shore Artists Group created an engaging and interactive mural entitled "The Perfect Sea" to educate children and adults about the sea and its ecology; in particular, how pollution affects sea life in our local waters.

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

Free admission.

All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed

title: Exhibit: Fire and Tide - Terra Marine Inn: A Brief History of Huguenot Park, Staten Island
description:
Date: November 1, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

Start time: 10:00 am

title: Exhibit: The Perfect Sea Mural
description:
Date: November 2, 2021

Members of the South Shore Artists Group created an engaging and interactive mural entitled "The Perfect Sea" to educate children and adults about the sea and its ecology; in particular, how pollution affects sea life in our local waters.

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

Free admission.

All current COVID-19 protocols to be followed

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (917) 417-6917

Location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
categories: Education | Art | Best for Kids | Seniors

title: Exhibit: Fire and Tide - Terra Marine Inn: A Brief History of Huguenot Park, Staten Island
description:
Date: November 2, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.

Start time: 10:00 am

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (917) 417-6817

Location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
location: Conference House Park Visitor Center (in Conference House Park)
categories: Art | History

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: November 3, 2021

Join us for Fitness at the Fort!

Incorporating climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing.

Instructor: Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS

Start: October 18, 2022

End : January 14, 2022

Hiatus: November 8-19

Fall/Winter 2021-2022 Class Descriptions:

Mondays: Easy Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Wednesdays: Moderate Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Fridays: Intense Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises.

Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path.

Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

Start time: 7:00 am

End time: 7:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)
categories: Nature | Fitness | Outdoor Fitness | Seniors

The exhibition will be on display at the Lenape Gallery at the Conference House Park Visitors Center through the end of the year.

description:
Date: November 3, 2021

Explore a bit of Staten Island's past and history.

The Fire and Tide exhibition explores the history of the former turn of the century Terra Marine Inn. This hotel was a wonderful piece of Staten Island gilded past. The exhibit combines history and original artwork focusing on the bygone location.

Free admission. Exhibit on display through December.

All COVID-19 protocols to be followed.
